perturbation.original_text: ISA shall perform all services required to be performed by ISA under this Agreement in a professional manner and all ISA personnel assigned to provide such services shall be duly qualified to provide such services; and     9.1.5 While at Rubicon's facilities, all ISA employees, contractors, consultants and agents shall observe and follow Rubicon's reasonable work rules, policies and standards as the same are communicated to ISA or such persons in writing, including, without limitation, those rules, policies and standards of Rubicon relating to security of and access to its facilities and to its telephone systems, electronic mail systems and computer systems. ISA shall cooperate with Rubicon in promptly removing from the Rubicon premises any of such persons who violates any of the foregoing work rules, policies or standards of Rubicon.
perturbation.changed_text: ISA shall perform all services required to be performed by ISA under this Agreement in a professional manner; and     9.1.5 While at Rubicon's facilities, all ISA employees, contractors, consultants and agents shall observe and follow Rubicon's reasonable work rules, policies and standards as the same are communicated to ISA or such persons in writing, including, without limitation, those rules, policies and standards of Rubicon relating to security of and access to its facilities and to its telephone systems, electronic mail systems and computer systems. ISA shall cooperate with Rubicon in promptly removing from the Rubicon premises any of such persons who violates any of the foregoing work rules, policies or standards of Rubicon.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the phrase 'all ISA personnel assigned to provide such services shall be duly qualified to provide such services' weakens the assurance of competence in service delivery. Florida law implies a duty to provide competent service; removing this weakens the commitment and could lead to disputes over service quality.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duty of competent service under Florida contract law.

perturbation.original_text: Rubicon shall perform all services required to be performed by Rubicon under this Agreement in a professional manner and all Rubicon personnel assigned to provide such services shall be duly qualified to provide such services; and     9.2.5 While at ISA's facilities, all Rubicon employees, contractors, consultants and agents shall observe and follow ISA's reasonable work rules, policies and standards as the same are communicated to Rubicon or such persons in writing, including, without limitation, those rules, policies and standards of ISA relating to security of and access to its facilities and to its telephone systems, electronic mail systems and computer systems. Rubicon shall cooperate with ISA in promptly removing from the ISA premises any of such persons who violates any of the foregoing work rules, policies or standards of ISA.
perturbation.changed_text: Rubicon shall perform all services required to be performed by Rubicon under this Agreement in a professional manner; and     9.2.5 While at ISA's facilities, all Rubicon employees, contractors, consultants and agents shall observe and follow ISA's reasonable work rules, policies and standards as the same are communicated to Rubicon or such persons in writing, including, without limitation, those rules, policies and standards of ISA relating to security of and access to its facilities and to its telephone systems, electronic mail systems and computer systems. Rubicon shall cooperate with ISA in promptly removing from the ISA premises any of such persons who violates any of the foregoing work rules, policies or standards of ISA.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the phrase 'all Rubicon personnel assigned to provide such services shall be duly qualified to provide such services' weakens the assurance of competence in service delivery. Florida law implies a duty to provide competent service; removing this weakens the commitment and could lead to disputes over service quality.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duty of competent service under Florida contract law.

perturbation.original_text: EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT, ISA AND RUBICON HEREBY DISCLAIM  ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, WITH RESPECT TO ANY AND ALL ISA AND RUBICON SERVICES  RESPECTIVELY, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR  PURPOSE, TITLE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: ISA AND RUBICON HEREBY DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, WITH RESPECT TO ANY AND ALL ISA AND RUBICON SERVICES  RESPECTIVELY, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR  PURPOSE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT.
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT' and 'TITLE' implies that there might be express warranties elsewhere and takes away consumer right. Under Florida law, warranty of title is implied, unless explicitly disclaimed.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida's implied warranty of title under the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC).
